content.description:
A fun route and likely the easiest venue on the wall.

Scramble approach to the base of the route.

Climb fractured slab.

"Every crag should have a Low(e) Route."
content.protection: Standard trad rack.  Belay would be a sling on a tree.
content.location:
Left most route on the main Comeposer Wall.

Located after a scramble up left to a small ledge below the shorter west side of the crag.

content.description:
A great line up the most prominent feature at the crag.

Climb up the prow, slotting small gear when available.

Steep and exposed with excellent movement in an airy and scenic environment.
content.protection: Traditional rack to include small cams.  Doubles and even triples on small TCU's (or equivalent) would be prudent.  Fixed anchor on top of route.
content.location: Located where the crag breaks from east to west aspect.  Obvious prow at the transition in orientation.

content.description:
Solid rock and fun climbing up a steep, clean face.

Start up blocky features aiming for a steep finger crack.  Folllow crack and steep slab to top of route.

Route ends on a large ledge.  Anchor is/was a dead tree which was a burned stump most likely from a lightening strike.  This anchor may not be available so plan on going further back and finding another option.
content.protection: Double set of finger sized pro and trad rack.
content.location:
On a flat, shorter face to the right of the prow and past the cluster of routes at and on either side of the prow (Harmony).

Just right of a fairly large, blocky roof cutout.  Look for the finger crack in the middle of the steep slab.
